Package com.rapidminer.belt.buffer

Class RealBufferSparse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.buffer.RealBufferSparse
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Integer53BitBufferSparse
    public class RealBufferSparse
extends java.lang.Object
    Sparse real buffer implementation with fixed length, storing double values. The buffer is write only. The setNext(double) method can be used to set the next free position in the buffer to the given value. The setNext(int, double) method can be used to set a specific position to the given value. In this case all values at smaller indices (that have not already been set) will be set to the buffer's default value. This is more efficient than calling setNext(double) for every default value. Please note that values, once they are set, cannot be modified.

    Please note that the buffer implementation is thread safe but accessing it from multiple threads will be slow.

    The buffer's efficiency will depend on the data's sparsity. The buffer will usually be memory and time efficient for data with a sparsity of >= 50%. The sparse buffer comes with a constant memory overhead so that it is recommended not to use it for very small data (<1024 data points).

    Author:
    Kevin Majchrzak
    See Also:
    RealBuffer, Buffers

    • Method Detail

      • setNext

        public void setNext​(double value)
        Sets the value at the next buffer position to the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If attempting to add more than size() values.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the buffer is frozen (see toColumn()).

      • setNext

        public void setNext​(int index,
                    double value)
        Sets the value at the given index to the given value. All indices <= the given index that have not been set so far will be set to the default value. Please note that you cannot modify an index smaller than or equal to the given index after calling this method. Trying to access an index <= the largest index that has already been set will lead to an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which to set the value
        value - the value to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If index is <= the largest index that has already been set.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified index is outside of the buffer's bounds.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the buffer is frozen (see toColumn()).

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the buffer's overall size (not the number of elements currently inside the buffer).
        Returns:
        the buffer's size.

      • type

        public Column.TypeId type()
        Returns the buffer's Column.TypeId.
        Returns:
        Column.TypeId.REAL.

      • toColumn

        public Column toColumn()
        Returns a column constructed from this buffer. The buffer will be frozen and it becomes read-only. In contrast to constructing a new buffer from a column this does not copy the data.
        Returns:
        a column with the data from this buffer

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
